melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਰਹਣੁ ਨ ਪਾਵਹਿ ਸੁਰਿ ਨਰ ਦੇਵਾ ॥

translation.text: The angelic beings and demi-gods are not permitted to remain here.

transliteration.text: rahan n pāvah sur nar dēvā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਊਠਿ ਸਿਧਾਰੇ ਕਰਿ ਮੁਨਿ ਜਨ ਸੇਵਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The silent sages and humble servants also must arise and depart. ||1||

transliteration.text: ūth sidhārē kar mun jan sēvā .1.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਜੀਵਤ ਪੇਖੇ ਜਿਨ੍ਹੀ ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਧਿਆਇਆ ॥

translation.text: Only those who meditate on the Lord, Har, Har, are seen to live on.

transliteration.text: jīvat pēkhē jinhī har har dhiāiā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

translation.text: In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, they obtain the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

translation.text: Kings, emperors and merchants must die.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

translation.text: Whoever is seen shall be consumed by death. ||2||

translation.text: Mortal beings are entangled, clinging to false worldly attachments.

translation.text: And when they must leave them behind, then they regret and grieve. ||3||

text: ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਕਉ ਕਰਹੁ ਦਾਤਿ ॥

translation.text: O Lord, O treasure of mercy, please bless Nanak with this gift,

transliteration.text: kripā nidhān nānak kau karah dāt .

translation.text: that he may chant Your Name, day and night. ||4||8||14||
